edu.blackburn.cs.cs212.restaurantbase

Class Receipt

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.blackburn.cs.cs212.restaurantbase.Receipt

  • public class Receipt
extends java.lang.Object
    Generates a printable Receipt as a string from a given set of objects that implement Orderable

      • prepare

        public java.lang.String prepare()
        Write the items as a long String with new lines, one for each item
        Returns:
        the full receipt as a formatted String, can be printed to the screen or added to a GUI

      • getTotalPrice

        public Money getTotalPrice()
        Get the total price of all items on this receipt as a new Money object
        Returns:
        the total price of all objects on the receipt

      • getTotalString

        Get the total as a string
        Returns:

      • toFormattedReceiptLine

        public static java.lang.String toFormattedReceiptLine(java.lang.String name,
                                                      Money price)
        Modified from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/388461/how-can-i-pad-a-string-in-java
        Parameters:
        name - the text description of the item
        price - the price of the item (total, if subitems)
        Returns:
        a modified toString, padded to a set number of spaces (or trimmed to that number of spaces)
